results.content: Good primer for using Git and GitHub versioning system. A walk-through of the Branching and Merging video (15) could help the student better understand the workflow diagram. I liked the Trello demo. I had no idea it could be that tightly integrated.

results.content: Perfect training material and the way it was presented is just superb for a professional like me coming back into IT after a gap of 6+ years. Thank you very much Brett Hooper for putting this material together in a concise and fast learning manner and importantly injecting confidence for a comeback professional.

results.content: Great course. Very simple to follow. Before this course, I had tried learning it on my own and from co-workers, and kept getting confused. This course provided the "lightbulb moment" I was looking for. And it only took about a half day to get there. Thanks!

results.content:
This course was amazing. I learned SOOOOO much. The way Brett instructed the course was likebeing in a classroom with him. Anytime I started to have a question, he answered it in the lecture!
He was very experienced in all subjects and spoke at a pace where you could follow easily. BY far the best course so far. He also threw a little humor into the moix to keep things engaging!

results.content:
I highly recommend this course for anyone who wants to understand everything from basic Git commands to how to use Git and Github in a team environment. 

The instructor explains everything clearly and simply using real-world scenarios. There is an appropriate amount of repetition and the scenarios are well suited to demonstrate each concept.

I especially appreciated the section on working in a team environment and how merging, branching and pull requests work. 

Thank you for the great course!
results.content_html:

Thank you for the great course!

results.content: Top notch training!  Clearly stated with excellent visuals.  The last of 4 sections missed the mark.  Pages.Github, C9/etc. integrations have no impact on my life.  More GitHub info like working with projects, wikis and issues would have provided more appropriate information.  Still excellent training.
results.content_html: Top notch training! Clearly stated with excellent visuals. The last of 4 sections missed the mark. Pages.Github, C9/etc. integrations have no impact on my life. More GitHub info like working with projects, wikis and issues would have provided more appropriate information. Still excellent training.

results.content:
PROS
The course was very good.  The instructor obviously knew the subject matter very well.  This course was on GIT & GITHUB.   I now feel comfortable with being able to begin the process of working with GIT.
This was the reason I opted for this course over the others and I was not disappointed with my selection.

The only cons...
Not sure when this course was created but pushing a new branch did not work as presented in the video. Trying to push the new branch with just git push... did not work.... ( this was how the tutorial said to do it )   I had to use.... git push --set-upstream origin about-feature
And, the only other thing that was missing was.... pulling down a previous commit.  I am not sure how to access a previous version of my code.  I'll be googling for this now and can't imagine it will be too hard but it would have been a soup to nuts tutorial if this was part of it.

Overall, I'm very satisfied with this course.
Thank you very much,
Sincerely,
Bob McClellan
results.content_html:
PROS
The course was very good. The instructor obviously knew the subject matter very well. This course was on GIT & GITHUB. I now feel comfortable with being able to begin the process of working with GIT.
This was the reason I opted for this course over the others and I was not disappointed with my selection.

The only cons...
Not sure when this course was created but pushing a new branch did not work as presented in the video. Trying to push the new branch with just git push... did not work.... ( this was how the tutorial said to do it ) I had to use.... git push --set-upstream origin about-feature
And, the only other thing that was missing was.... pulling down a previous commit. I am not sure how to access a previous version of my code. I'll be googling for this now and can't imagine it will be too hard but it would have been a soup to nuts tutorial if this was part of it.

Overall, I'm very satisfied with this course.
Thank you very much,
Sincerely,
Bob McClellan

results.content:
He managed to clearly cover a ton of info in a short time all the while leaving out all the self glorifying bullshit or the lengthy dialog about nothing that that usually says "I have to talk so much because I know more than you and you are just not going to get it no matter how many different ways I explain".  

note:  
Feel free to remove or substitute the "bad word" from my review if it scares you.
